title: Leaping at last: "Black Panther"
contents: The first Marvel film with a black superhero at its heart,  as well as a black director at the helm,  will be released next week. It has been eagerly anticipated: many have taken to Twitter to share #WhatBlackPantherMeansToMe; a video of children at a school in Atlanta reacting to news of a trip to see the flick has gone viral.

But while its diversity and originality have drawn widespread praise from fans and critics alike,  some have been less kind. A campaign on Facebook to "give 'Black Panther' a rotten audience score on Rotten Tomatoes",  a review aggregator,  was taken down by the social-media site for violating "community standards". It has not stopped "Black Panther" from breaking records even before its release,  with more presales than any other superhero movie. It enjoys a 98% "fresh" rating from critics on Rotten Tomatoes,  too.
